Job Description:
We are looking for an experienced and passionate Senior DevOps Engineer to
join our team to help build and maintain Payzer’s AWS cloud infrastructure.
Your contributions will be visible and make a difference to our team, our SaaS
product, and most importantly to our customers. This challenging position
requires a person who thrives working in a fast-paced environment with the
ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously.

While preference is given to applicants local to Charlotte, NC, this position
is open to remote employment.

 **We're looking for people who are:**

  * Good humans with a positive attitude
  * Bright, inquisitive and good at getting things done
  * Great at listening to other people
  * Able to communicate clearly both orally and in writing
  * Love making our customers happy
  * Ready to work hard, learn and grow in a fast-paced environment
  * Eager to be part of a great team on an exciting ride in the heart of South Charlotte
  * Honest, fun to be around and cool to work with while getting the job done

  

  

**Payzer is a fast-growing software company in Charlotte, North Carolina.**

  
We make and sell both Payzer, the all-in-one financial tool that helps
contractors grow their business, and Payzerware, the all-in-one management
tool that helps contractors run their business.

  
Our products deliver:

  * Inbound call management and CRM
  * Technician scheduling and dispatch
  * Appointments and reminders
  * Sales proposals, invoices and maintenance agreements
  * Easy to use online and mobile payment solutions
  * Instant loan decisions that help grow average order size
  * Effective promotional offers that help close business
  * Simple electronic cash management
  * Rich financial and customer level reporting

  

  

Our company has grown rapidly because we have great teammates, an excellent
product, and lots of happy customers.

 **Requirements**

  * Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience
  * 7+ years experience in software development and/or technical operations support
  * Strong AWS cloud services understanding and experience
  * Experience with IaC (Infrastructure as Code) with a strong desire to automate
  * Production-level experience in Terraform, Docker, ECS, ECR, and Fargate
  * Experience with monolith and micro service architectures
  * Linux and shell scripting
  * Strong understanding of basic networking
  * Solid on managing both LAMP stack and java service apps
  * Design, configure, and support software build/deploy pipelines (CI/CD, Git, GitLab)
  * Assist with software deployment through various staged operating environments (e.g., Development, QA, Staging, Production)
  * Ability to make recommendations to resolve problems by using judgment that is consistent with Payzer's culture
  * Demonstrated ability to manage projects from end to end with minimal supervision
  * Friendly and professional with development, product, quality assurance, and management teams.
  * Bonus if experienced with compliance frameworks like PCI

**Benefits**

  * The chance to be early at a fast growing, fully funded venture-backed startup. You won’t be just another drone at Payzer.
  * You can get in on the ground floor. Learn more at payzerware.com 
  * A professional work environment that’s non-corporate. 
  * We have a casual dress code and while we work hard, we care about our families and are cool if you do, too.
  * Medical insurance: Choice of 2 plans that are 100% employer paid for the whole family
  * Dental, vision, short and long-term disability, and life insurance
  * 401(k) plan
  * FSA and HSA Accounts
  * Paid time off

Opanga Networks is the world’s leading innovator of 4G and 5G Mobile Network
optimization technologies. Processing terabits of traffic everyday through our
globally deployed products, Opanga is the industry expert in developing and
deploying high performance optimization solutions in virtualized, cloud and
distributed data center environments. Using the latest techniques and
platforms, our team sits on the bleeding edge of network evolution. Simply
put, we make mobile wireless networks much faster and much cheaper to operate.

Opanga is looking for the next engineering superstar to join our expanding
team… Could this be you?

 **What should you expect as an Opanga Software Engineer?**

As a member of the Opanga team you will take design requirements and convert
them to high quality code in a timely manner. You will work with a team of
professional software engineers to deliver top-quality software to our end
users. You will participate in full life cycle of our products including
design, development, code reviews, patent creation and write up, testing,
documentation and support.

 **We asked our engineers what they loved about their roles at Opanga, and
here is what they said:**

  * Contributing meaningfully to new and already-deployed business-critical network optimization solutions with a global reach
  * Participating in the roll out of new and existing customer deployments
  * Working closely with product owners to define the scope of work for upcoming releases
  * Developing high-performance, network-level software running on bare-metal and virtual environments
  * Evolving solutions for monitoring and management as well as big data sourcing, processing, and visualization
  * Building and improving both small and large scale testing tools, frameworks, and methodologies that support our products
  * Challenging yourself by exercising self-driven learning and team problem-solving on a daily basis
  * Cultivating a broad scope of technical and non-technical skills driven by a lively startup culture.
  * Sharing findings, knowledge, and experiences with other team members
  * Enjoying a flexible, friendly work atmosphere
  * Travel opportunities world-wide to a variety of countries for testing and deployment
  * Realizing the wide-reaching potential of algorithms with new opportunities for research, enhancement, and experimentation
  * Learning about emerging stacks, technologies and improving products from the user-interface down to the bare metal

 **Some of the things you might find on an Opanga Networks employee’s resume
include:**

  * Designed and implemented a scalable NFV deployment, using OpenStack for a high-performance network environment. This design was used to deploy optimization technology across multiple countries and millions of subscribers.
  * Worked through the entire process of analysis to design to implementation for products including high efficiency network code to front end web development.
  * Improved the build process to automatically deploy software onto virtualized infrastructure to perform a gamut of regression and performance tests using Jenkins, Ansible and OpenStack.
  * Designed and implemented a rigorous black-box testing suite in Python for a C software library with hundreds of thousands of lines of code.
  * Worked with a broad set of development tools and languages such as C/C++, JAVA, Python, React, Spring, Postgres and ElasticSearch.

This is just a small sampling of the tasks that you will be met with on a
daily basis at Opanga. Are you up for the challenge?

 **Requirements: DevOps Engineer**

· Minimum 2-3 years experience programming in Bash/Linux,

· Minimum 2 years experience Python programming

· Familiarity with programming languages such as C/Java and Javascript

· Experience in Virtual technologies (AWS, Openstack, Kubernetes, Docker,
Rancher)

· Comfortable in managing and supporting internal developer tools, such as
Internally hosted gitlab as well as containerized environment for internal
services

· Familiarity with CI/CD features within gitlab for various development
projects

· Have a working knowledge of internally hosted task tracking system, Wiki and
Artifactory system

· Familiarity with NAS tools such as Synology and comparable brands and how to
configure such tools for automatic remote backups.

· Ability to update and manage networking security policies within multiple
firewalls, switches and wireless access points

Other Duties may include:

· Managing our customer deployments and internal customer fulfillment system

· Setting up and verifying VPN connections to customer sites within our
firewalls

· Generating license and configuration files for our products that will be
deployed to customer sites

· Deploying and verifying successful deployments of software products to
customer sites

· Verifying successful configuration of alarm and monitoring setup for
customer deployments.

· Wildcard certificate management

· Networking Support

· Create Network Diagrams

· Create and manage Site to Site VPN connections

· Manage security policies within switches

· Manage static and dynamic IP addresses within an internal network

· Manage VLANs within an internal network

· Manage security policies for VLANs

· Manage DHCP allocations for servers within an internal network

Beyond Finance is a next generation financial services company. Our goal is to
provide financial peace of mind to our clients by giving them simple and
transparent financial products that are customized to their individual
circumstances.

We're in constant pursuit of new collaborators that will help us get to the
next level. Our workforce includes celebrated, diverse talents working towards
the common objective of developing something transformational for the debt
relief industry.

Our team spirit and culture are what set us apart as a company. We love what
we do, and we have fun doing it.

About the Role

We are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer who specializes in AWS to develop,
maintain, and support our growing infrastructure and application development.
As a Senior DevOps Engineer you will provide strategic, innovative, and cost-
effective solutions to increase efficiency, reliability, and integration of
our services and operations. You will work in a semi-autonomous environment
where fast prototyping of emerging technologies to solve industry-related
problems is the rule.

What You’ll Do

  * Build and maintain our entire AWS technology stack, from ECS to ELBs and databases to launch and support our internal applications in partnership with our AWS Architect
  * Work closely with our internal engineering teams to automate manual processes and support our continuous integration and continuous delivery code pipelines
  * Build and maintain tools, solutions, and microservices associated with deployment and our operations platform, ensuring we meet our customer service standards and reduce errors
  * Actively troubleshoot any issues that arise during testing and production, catch and solve issues before launch
  * Test our system integrity and continuously make improvements to our infrastructure
  * Update our processes and design new processes as needed
  * Deploy product updates as required while implementing integrations when they arise
  * Automate our operational processes as needed, with accuracy and in compliance with our security requirements

What We Look For

  * Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s in Computer Science, Engineering, Software Engineering or a relevant field.
  * More than two years of experience in a DevOps Engineer role (or similar role)
  * Experience in software development and infrastructure development is a plus
  * Strong experience with Linux-based infrastructures, Linux/Unix administration, and AWS
  * Strong experience with database technologies such as PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, NoSQL, ElasticSearch, Redis, Cassandra, and/or Mongo
  * Knowledge of scripting languages such as JavaScript, Ruby, Python, and Bash
  * Experience with open-source technologies and cloud services
  * Experience in working with Selenium or equivalent for automation and configuration
  * Strong communication skills and ability to explain protocol and processes with team and management
  * Stellar troubleshooting skills with the ability to spot issues before they become problems
  * Current with industry trend and best practices, ability to identify the ones we should implement
  * Strong time and project management skills, with the capability to prioritize and multitask as needed

Why join us?  
We are looking for great people to join a fast-paced, growing, and innovative
business. For eligible fulltime employees, we offer:

  * Considerable employer contributions for health, dental and vision programs
  * Generous personal time-off
  * 401(K) match
  * Merit advancement opportunities
  * Career development & training

More importantly, our team spirit and culture are what really sets us apart as
a company. We’re a world-class company that loves what we do…and we have fun
doing it!

Development Operations Engineer

Remote Senior DevOps for Google Cloud Platform

 **Qualifications**

 **MUST HAVE: GCP Professional Cloud DevOps Engineer certification**
https://cloud.google.com/certification/cloud-devops-engineer  
Experience with a mix of IAM, storage, compute, and networking services from
GCP services with concentration in App Engine,  
Compute Engine, Cloud Run, Cloud Storage, Cloud Functions, VPC, Cloud SQL,
PUB/SUB, Cloud Firestore, Cloud delivery pipelines using JSON or YAML and
understand designing incremental promotion across environments  
Strong understanding of Linux Databases understanding NoSQL and Relational  
A working understanding of enterprise networking concepts like CIDR, routing,
subnets, and load balancing, VPN, on-prem to cloud traffic, firewalls, and
centralized cloud routers.  
Experience identifying and writing scripts to automate mundane tasks - be able
to interface with APIs in order to automate

 **What You'll Do**

You will play a critical role in driving design, implementation, live
monitoring and maintenance of GCP cloud services.  
In this role you will be responsible for deploying, and supporting large scale
enterprise grade cloud architectures.  
You will design CI/CD pipelines to cover deployment of base foundational
capabilities, zones, and application patterns (e.g.  
Infrastructure, data, model, serverless, container, VMs)  
Your CI/CD pipeline implementations will include artifacts, test suites, test
data management, static analysis, multi region, resiliency, security checks,
ephemeral environments, promotion environments, multiple
accounts/projects/subscriptions, secrets management, and authentication
isolation.  
As part of this role you will also prepare and present system documentation
and analysis to management and client leadership.  
Several systems administration duties will also be critical in this role
including privileged authentication into servers/accounts/projects  
/subscriptions to review logs and triage problems.

 **Nice to have - Machine Learning**

Construct machine learning lifecycle management including data collection,
normalization, and standardization within a data pipeline construction  
Experience developing **Google Cloud AutoML** infrastructure for model
selection and hyperparameter tuning  
Experience with Google AI technologies **TensorFlow, TPUs, and TFX**  
Exerience with **Google Cloud Datalab**  
Create applications and interface to present the output of ML models  
Experiment, develop and productionize high quality machine learning services
and platforms to make huge technology and business impact.  
Develop hosting platform for machine learning models.  
Create pipelines to query and retrieve and update data for existing
applications to keep them updated  
Supervise the scaling and management of the machine learning modeling
ecosystem  
 **Work alongside data scientists and product owners to improve aspects of
their lines of business through machine learning**

 **Nice to have - Data Scientist**

Exerience with **Google Cloud Datalab**

Extract and transform data from multiple sources in preparation for
exploratory data analysis, modeling, and reporting.  
Leverage predictive and inferential advanced statistical and machine learning
techniques to solve business problems, including methods to surface
uncertainty intervals to provide increased context.  
Transform model outputs into formats that are digestible to the end users
through visualization, clear tables, and/or thoughtful presentations. Assist
technical and non-technical end users in how to leverage and interpret the
analysis.  
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities
for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.  
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and
improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business
strategies.  
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources, data gathering
techniques, and data standardization through homogenizing data sources.  
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Use
predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue
generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.  
Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.  
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor
outcomes.  
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data
accuracy.

Evolve is a hospitality company with a mission to make renting a vacation home
easy for everyone. Thanks to an unapologetic passion for hospitality, we now
support tens of thousands of owners across North America. We enjoy earning
each guest and owner's business - all while having some fun along the way.
Come join our fast-paced growth-stage culture, while enjoying the support of a
well funded company - we've raised over $235M in investment capital from
world-class investors like Durable Capital, T. Rowe Price, and Allen &
Company.

 **Why this role**

The Platform Engineer - DevOps will be a hands-on technology expert that will
play a key role in identifying, building and maintaining developer tooling and
systems that improve engineering efficiency and improve the organization's
delivery capabilities.

This role will support and collaborate closely with cross-functional product
teams focused on delivering features on our web platform.

This role requires experience building custom DevOps solutions for modern web
applications. Candidates must be comfortable contributing to strategy as well
as contributing tactically to the ecosystem and tools used by front-end teams.

**What you'll do**

  * Design and develop tools for automation to reduce operational friction and increase engineering efficiency.
  * Improve the day-to-day frontend development experience of Evolve engineers by supporting rapid iteration and real time feedback about accessibility and performance.
  * Collaborate across teams to identify DevOps needs and craft solutions.
  * Research, document, and build proof-of-concepts for potential solutions to tooling changes.
  * Maintain and setup Gitlab repositories, create templates and automate/standardize new project setup.
  * Provision infrastructure with Terraform.
  * Enable teams to safely and easily continuously integrate and deploy code with CI/CD pipelines.
  * Automate unit and integration testing, setup and manage test data.
  * Own core JavaScript libraries that let product teams build and experiment on web applications that are resilient, performant, and operationally sound.
  * Research promising new tools and technologies, push the team to experiment and evolve

**What makes you a great fit**

  * 3+ years bespoke web application development with a focus on front-end and/or DevOps.
  * Experience automating infrastructure provisioning, DevOps, and/or continuous integration/delivery.
  * Experience automating unit and integration testing (react-testing-library, jest, cypress, selenium).
  * Experience building, testing, packaging, and versioning javascript/typescript libraries (storybook, sem-ver).
  * Can debug problems that span across systems, and design solutions that span the whole stack.
  * Experience with AWS or other cloud infrastructure providers.
  * Experience building deployment pipelines (Gitlab, Docker, AWS).
  * Have experience using trunk-based development methods.
  * Have taken part in design sprints and can prototype quickly.
  * Has been successful in a scrum working environment and knows how to get the most out of Agile and Lean methodologies.
  * Understands how to build and scale front-end design systems and component libraries.
  * Experience building modern front-ends with Javascript/Typescript, React, and Next.js.
  * Dedication to learning and always striving to improve.

**Location**

Evolve has a flexible working environment so teammates can work remotely
anywhere in the state of Colorado, in our beautiful downtown Denver office,
remotely or a hybrid of both! As we grow, we are working towards opening
remote opportunities across the entire U.S. We currently are able to hire
across the U.S except in the following locations: California, District of
Columbia, Hawaii, Minnesota, New Jersey, New Mexico, Ohio, Oregon and
Pennsylvania.

**Compensation**

For this role our salary range is $109,000 to $125,000, depending on relevant
experience.

Additional compensation details:

Equity: $25,000 of equivalent RSUs

  

**Total approximate compensation** **:** $115,250 - $131,250

 **Total Rewards at Evolve**

At Evolve, we care for our teammates by supporting their physical, mental, and
financial wellbeing through a comprehensive Total Rewards Program.

  * Industry competitive pay, including equity in the company for all Evolvers
  * Health insurance package options that include 100% employer paid HDHP plan and two PPO plan options for you and your dependents
  * Employer-paid dental, and vision, for you and your qualified dependents
  * Paid life insurance, short-term disability, and long-term disability coverage
  * 401(k) with a 4% match that vests immediately
  * PTO, sick days, and paid Parental Leave
  * Rich learning and development program for Evolvers

But wait, there's more… optional benefits offered include commuter benefits,
pet insurance and travel perks.

**About Us**

Opportunity: Our leadership and management teams are dedicated to creating
meaningful learning and growth opportunities for all Evolvers, as well as
providing clear expectations and continuous feedback.

Community: It's easy to make friends at Evolve. We support maintaining a
strong community through our teammate-led groups focused on learning,
inclusion, environmental wellness, and more.

Transparency: Every month, our leadership team shares how the company is
performing, explaining where we're headed next, and recognizing team members
for jobs well done.

Values: They mean more to Evolve than just bullets on a page, they drive our
daily decisions and impact how we work as a hospitality company.

  * Earn It
  * Build Loyalty One Interaction at a Time
  * Communicate Often, Honestly & Directly
  * Embrace Change
  * Stay Hungry & Humble
  * Care
  * Be Efficient
  * Take Risks
  * Learn Every Day
  * Have Some Fun Along the Way

Which value sounds the most like you?

_Evolve is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that a diverse work
environment is a successful work environment so all qualified candidates will
be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender,
gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics,
disability, age, or veteran status._

**_**CANDIDATE MUST BE IN TAMPA, FL. THIS IS AN ON-SITE POSITION*_**

The Jr. DevOps Engineer position is responsible for the maintenance, support,
deployment and repair of corporate infrastructure, and creating new products
and services for Hivelocity to sell to clients. Duties include responding to
phone and ticket requests that technical support cannot support due to
complexity. DevOP engineers manage, maintain and deploy corporate servers and
provide 24/7/365 technical support on those servers. This position directly
reports to the DevOPs Manager.

 **Responsibilities:**

 _This is a hands-on position, which will require the following capabilities:_

  * Contribute in the DevOps/Operations team to maintain and build out our infrastructure and servers including new products and services.

  * Evolve infrastructure, server, deployment strategies and testing to support our goal of deploying new products and services while managing old services.

  * Continuously improve our infrastructure to be easy to deploy, scalable, secure and fault-tolerant.

  * Work closely with our Development Team, Technical Support, Managers and DevOps/Operations team to meet the needs of the organization to stay competitive - from the infrastructure up to the highest level of applications.

 **Requirements and Qualifications:**

  * You are smart with an intellectual curiosity that motivates you to keep on top of technical trends - but you also have deep knowledge in the tools of choice.

  * You have supported Linux/Unix/Windows deployments, configurations in large and small environments.

  * You have designed, monitored and managed scalable and fault-tolerant deployments and supported them in real-world scenarios.

  * You have experience with continuous integration; log collection and analysis, builds and performance monitoring/tuning of your infrastructure.

  * You are service-oriented, and enjoy working with engineers to make the software development process as painless as possible.

  * You are comfortable testing and deploying new technologies.

  * You are extremely reliable and we can count on you in times of need and are used to being on-call/pager duty. You have experience with a vast number of Linux and Windows Services.

  * You work well with others and communicate well with others.

  * You document your work on daily basis.

  * Support for Dedicated/VPS server when Technical Support cannot.

  * Analyze and interpret client needs.

  * Interact with support staff to resolve issues.

  * Perform basic troubleshooting and problem isolation.

  * Maintain problem ownership and accountability.

  * Perform miscellaneous projects and duties as assigned.

  * Maintain a clean and safe work environment.

 **Preferences**

  * Previous experience working with distributed teams - directly interacting with the development teams.

  * Experience with Proxmox, Xen, KVM and other Virtualization Technologies.

  * Experience with network and server security.

  * Experience Active Directory, LDAP, and Yubikey.

  * Experience with OpenVPN and other VPN Technolgies.

  * Can manage Linux, Unix, BSD, MacOSX, and WIndows

  * College Degree or Technical Degree, and/or technical certifications in systems like Microsoft, Cisco, Linux, Security, Network+, and Novell.

 **Expectations**

· The ability to communicate professionally in a fast-paced setting while
maintaining a positive working environment.

· Ability to be a team player and a self-starter.

· Ability to work in a 24/7/365 scheduled and on-call environment.

· Ability to maintain high level of customer satisfaction.

 **Perks**

  * Full benefits (Health, Dental, Vision, 401k)
  * Tuition reimbursement
  * Bottomless coffee and free lunch on Fridays!
  * Company outings
  * Soccer team
  * Voted one of the _2016 Best Places To Work_ by the Tampa Bay Business Journal

 ****RECRUITERS DO NOT CONTACT****

Work Remotely

  * No

Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary
role at Fidelity Investments. We are currently sourcing for a Senior DevOps
Engineer to work in Salt Lake City, Utah.

A successful candidate has technical depth and hands-on experience with modern
practices and tools in the DevOps toolchain.

## **The Team**

We are Customer Protection, and we build the services that protect millions of
customers every day. We focus on delivering end-to-end product solutions where
stability and security are our highest priority. We are obsessed with
simplifying complex problems by automating everything and monitoring the right
things!

## **The Expertise You Have**

  * Bachelor's degree
  * 3-5+ years of experience in a DevOps role
  * Strong systems administration expertise
  * Experience with AWS services such as EKS, EC2, ECS and similar effective
  * Pipeline automation and orchestration utilizing the following stack or similar
  * GIT, Jenkins, Maven, JUnit, Docker, JMeter, Artifactory, Sonar, Vericode, Kubernetes
  * Monitoring automation systems such as CloudWatch and Datadog or Splunk. Datadog preferred.
  * AWS Certified preferred

## **The Skills You Bring**

  * Ability to effectively collaborate in an agile team
  * Willingness to share on-call support rotation with your product team
  * Understanding of networking infrastructure and protocols
  * Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving

## **The Value You Deliver**

  * Integrating modern SaaS solutions and vendors with existing systems and services
  * Migrating legacy products to reduce technical debt
  * Sharing operational expertise in a team tackling for DevOps excellence
  * Forever learning and growing your skillsets to help build a well-rounded team
  * Automating yourself out of todays job so that you can move on to the next big challenge

**COVID Work Policy**

Safety is our top priority. Once we can be together in person with fewer
safety measures, this role will follow our dynamic working approach. You’ll be
spending some of your time onsite depending on the nature and needs of your
role.

**Dynamic Working – Post Pandemic**

Our aim is to combine the best of working offsite with coming together in
person. For most teams this means a consistent balance of working from home
and office that supports the needs of your role, experience level, and working
style.

Your success and growth is important to us, so you’ll want to enjoy the
benefits of coming together in person – face to face learning and training,
quality time with your manager and teammates, building your career network,
making friends, and taking full advantage of cultural and social experiences
Fidelity provides for you.

PlanetArt’s mission is to be the leading online destination for personalized
invitations, announcements, home décor and other personalized products. We

**DevOps Engineer**

Created by hospitality operators for hospitality operators, Avero is the
trusted technology partner for the hospitality industry. We empower 40,000+
hospitality professionals with the answers they need to transform their
businesses and their lives, getting them out of the back office and into the
kitchen with their staff, onto the floor with their guests, and at home with
their families. We are a remote-first company with headquarters in New York
City.

 **POSITION OVERVIEW**

Avero is currently looking for a DevOps Engineer for our Product Operations
teams who will be responsible for working collaboratively with the engineering
team to deploy and operate our systems. Your primary focus will be to automate
and streamline operations and processes, build, and maintain tools for
deployment, monitoring, and operations, and troubleshoot and resolves issue in
our dev, staging and production environments. Candidates must demonstrate
strong technical knowledge with a passion for service. This is a 100% remote
role reporting to Avero’s Vice President of Product Operations.

Our Product Operations team maintains both our cloud-based and on-premises
infrastructure that provides the foundation for all Avero’s products. The team
leverages the latest cutting-edge technologies to provide high availability
and high performing systems for the engineering team. They follow the
Everything-as-Code philosophy to create a stable, robust, and dynamic
infrastructure that can adapt quickly to emerging technology trends.

 **WHO YOU ARE:**

  * An experienced DevOps Engineer who enjoys working within and nurturing highly collaborative remote-first teams and organizations.
  * Team player with a positive attitude and the ability to interact effectively with your staff at all levels of the organization.
  * An outstanding communicator who can help translate technical concepts and concerns to non-technical stakeholders.
  * A strong individual contributor who can lead by example.
  * A steward of code, systems, documentation, and processes.

 **WHAT YOU’LL DO:**

  * Build and maintain Amazon Web Services cloud infrastructure (as code) including, but not limited to, the following:
  * Compute – EC2, ECS, Lambda
  * Storage – S3, EFS, Glacier, Storage Gateway
  * Database – RDS, RedShift
  * Networking – VPC, Route 53
  * Management – CloudWatch, Auto Scaling
  * Analytics – EMR, Elasticsearch
  * Security – IAM, Certificate Manager
  * Application Integration/Messaging – SES, SNS, SQS
  * Support on-premises hardware and software infrastructure including, but not limited to, the following:
  * FTP/FTPS/SFTP Servers
  * HTTP Servers – Apache, Tomcat
  * Oracle Enterprise Database
  * Oracle WebLogic
  * SAP Business Objects
  * Build and maintain custom solutions including, but not limited to, the following:
  * Custom HTTP file servers
  * Internal APIs
  * Data warehouse loading and maintenance scripts
  * Custom monitoring and alerting solutions
  * Support of migration of on-premises monolithic application infrastructure to cloud-based microservices
  * Design and implement monitoring and alerting systems
  * Explore, implement, and test new technologies
  * Participate in on-call pager rotation
  * Champion operational excellence, actively participating in the process of development and continuous improvement
  * Provide technical support to your team members, take ownership of your work, and always be learning
  * Participate in code reviews, defining and refining your team’s process

 **WHAT YOU’LL NEED:**

  * 5+ years of experience in DevOps and/or Systems Administration
  * Strong understanding of the core concepts of DevOps, microservices, systems administration, and monitoring/alerting

Required experience with the below:

  * Languages – Python, Java, Shell Scripting
  * Build tools – Gradle
  * Infrastructure Tools – Terraform, Chef
  * Container Infrastructure – Docker and Docker Compose, ECS
  * Databases – MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MS SQL Server
  * Elastic Stack – Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana
  * Source Control – Git and Bitbucket
  * Linux administration (Ubuntu, Fedora, and/or Amazon Linux)

You do not need to be an expert in everything but should have a significant
overlap with our existing technology stack. We can help you ramp up where
there are gaps.

  * Languages – Groovy, Perl
  * Build tools – Maven, Ant
  * Infrastructure Tools – Packer, CloudFormation
  * Databases – Oracle, RedShift
  * Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  * Experience working within remote or geographically distributed teams is preferable and a strong commitment to collaboration in a remote-first environment

 **WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE:**

  * Competitive compensation, coupled with an emphasis on work/life balance
  * Employer-sponsored benefits package including Health, Dental and Vision insurance

  * Health Savings Account with contributions from Avero quarterly!

scripts to automate the build process for the apps and deploy the apps for
internal testing and externally to the app stores.

This candidate should possess excellent DevOps skills, excellent problem
solving skills, the ability to prioritize well and communicate clearly.
Creative engineering balanced with high quality and a customer focus. Strong

looking for a highly motivated individual who is looking to grow their career

  * Develop scripts to automate the building of iOS and Android apps

  * Determine root cause for build and deployment issues and develop practical, efficient and stable solutions.

  * 4+ years of experience with CI/CD for native mobile apps, both iOS and Android.

  * 4+ years of experience with Jenkins, Docker, Fastlane, Gradle and Git

  * 4+ years of experience with Xcodebuild scripting, Python, Javascript and shell scripting

leader in medical devices and digital solutions for hypertension,
cardiovascular disease, and other vascular health disorders. Its CONNEQT
subsidiary develops and markets consumer home health devices and wearables.

develop and support applications across the Computershare portfolio. Working
within cross-functional teams, this role requires strong technical skills, a
passion for delivering quality solutions and the drive to continually improve
the quality and speed with which we deliver value to the business.

**Other key responsibilities include:**

  * Provide technical assistance to development teams to assist in the adoption and implementation DevOps practices including adoption of CI/CD
  * Configure and support centralised build and deployment infrastructure
  * Work with development teams to configure CI/CD pipelines
  * Automate the creation of environments and installation of software
  * Automate manual, repetitive tasks related to software build, deployment and operations
  * Develop guidelines and support documentation
  * Contribute to research into existing and emerging technologies to enable DevOps
  * Ensure solutions delivered are fit for purpose, meet security, risk and audit requirements, meet customer expectations and do not cause high severity outages
  * Collaborate with individuals and teams to promote knowledge sharing
  * Escalate risks and issues to the Team Lead / Management as appropriate
  * Provide regular contributions to team knowledge base, product wikis and support documentation
  * Implement cloud solutions and technologies

  

**What will you bring to the role?**

We are always looking at ways to improve how we work, so if you have an
inquisitive mind with great attention to detail, this position would be a
great fit.

**You’ll also need:**

  * Scripting skill sets – Python, PowerShell, JSON
  * Tooling from the DevOps Periodic Table 
  * Collaborates and communicates well, builds great working relationships, influences others, challenges effectively and responds well to challenge from others, shares information and ideas with others, has good listening skills.
  * Has a strong work ethic and is able to deal with sometimes conflicting priorities.
  * Curious and continuous learner – investigates, interprets and grasps new concepts.
  * Self-motivated and can use own initiative to work with limited guidance to implement innovative solutions.
  * Ability to find root cause and takes a rigorous approach to problem solving.

**Bonus points if you have:**

  * Infrastructure experience - AD, DNS, Windows Server Operating Systems, IIS, SQL, Load Balancing, Networking, High Availability / Data Recovery, Security (SSL, NIDS)
  * Experience managing Azure environments – VNets, NSG’s, Security centre, Storage blobs, PAAS services etc 
  * Preference will be given to candidates with Data CI/CD experience

**DevOps Engineer**

 **$80/hour+ DOE**

 **Remote- anywhere in US**

 **Temporary assignment: 9-months with possible extension**

 **  
About the Position**

Our client has one of the world's largest live video networks that powers the
many companies that are using live video to uniquely engage and build
communities where more than a billion hours are streamed live each month.
Amazon Interactive Video Service (IVS) is an AWS service that allows
developers to easily leverage the low-latency highly-distributed live video
platform that powers our client in their own applications. The Video Clients
team is looking for DevOps engineers to work on their CI/CD pipelines to
support Web, iOS, and Android clients. Their tooling pipelines will need to be
stable and reliable when building, testing, and deploying releases of our IVS
SDKs.

  
If you are passionate about video, streaming, or entertainment, and obsessed
with building CI/CD pipelines and automation tools, then this is the position
for you.

 **  
You Will**

  * Collaborate with engineers to understand their build pipelines and tooling needs.
  * Setup new operational systems and infrastructure.
  * Setup and maintain new build and Continuous Integration/Continuous Deploy systems.
  * Develop and maintain automated release systems.
  * Setup and integrate new monitoring and alerting systems.
  * Develop and maintain new services relevant to client operations.
  * Research new technologies and tooling.
  * Write automation scripts and tools in Python.

 **  
You Have**

  * 5+ years of experience in related DevOps roles.
  * Experience configuring & managing build pipelines.
  * Experience with maintaining systems designed around Infrastructure as code (IaC).
  * Experience designing and maintaining scalable cloud infrastructure using AWS EC2, S3, and/or equivalent technologies.
  * Experience building CI/CD pipeline for Web, iOS, and/or Android apps and SDKs.
  * Experience with building CI/CD solutions using tools like TeamCity, Jenkins, Gitlab, and Artifactory, AWS CodePipeline and AWS CodeBuild.
  * Experience writing automation scripts in Python, Ruby, bash, or similar languages.

 **  
Bonus Points**

  * Experience with cloud tools such as: Terraform, Docker, Cloud Development Kit (CDK), and CloudFormation.
  * Familiar with AWS Device Farms for Web and Mobile testing.
  * Exposure to modern C++ 11 and higher, Emscripten, and WebAssembly.
  * Understanding of video technologies.
  * Experience with platform pipelines, development, and languages related to Web, iOS, and/or Android.

 **Job Description**  
The Global Technology Legal Compliance (GTLC) team is looking for a talented
DevOps Engineer to join our CCI project and help maintain and evolve our CI/CD
and cloud infrastructure for SAP Corporate Intellectual Property (IP)
Compliance governance development and operation. Our ideal candidate is a
collaborative, pragmatic self-starter who excels at critical thinking,
learning, coaching, and executing in a fast-paced environment. You thrive on
positive interactions with team members and believe that growing as a team is
the sustainable model.

 **Responsibilities**  
You will contribute to design, development, documentation, testing and
operation support for our CI/CD and cloud solutions. You have strong verbal
and written communication skills, are self-driven, and can deliver high
quality results in a fast-paced environment. As a member of GTLC Development
team, you are the go-to person for all infrastructure questions. You work
closely with our developers and Corp IT teams to solve problems in our CI/CD
and cloud operations. You are obsessed with customer satisfaction and have
demonstrated passion to leverage cutting-edge technologies and automation
tooling to support beautiful cloud native products. You will design,
implement, troubleshoot, and improve our DevOps solutions. You may even join
the development force to implement and own some components.

You have Can-Do attitude and strong sense of ownership. You dive into complex
requirements and succinctly and accurately translate them into technical
requirements. Most importantly, you have a passion for learning, sharing, and
are driven to be the best at what you do.

 **Qualifications**

  * Bachelor’s Degree or above in Computer Science or a related field.
  * 5+ years professional work experience in DevOps.
  * Expert knowledge in Jenkins, proficiency in python, shell, groovy and build related tools, i.e. maven, gradle, Nexus, Artifactory, etc.
  * Excellent OS and network trouble-shooting skills on Unix/Linux and Windows.
  * Strong knowledge in Docker, Chef, Puppet, Kubernetes, OpenShift/OpenStack, ServiceMesh.
  * Strong knowledge in Ansible, Prometheus, Terraform, Kibana, Grafana, etc.
  * Working knowledge on GCP/AWS/Azure/SCP.
  * Working knowledge in at least one each of relational and NoSQL database preferably Hana, MSSQL, Postgres, MongoDB, Redis, Neo4j is a plus.
  * Experience in BI reporting in SAP BI platform, data modeling, dashboard solutions is a plus.
  * Familiar with agile software development methodology, especially scrum.
  * Demonstrated strong problem solving skills, self-direction, and effectiveness within teams.
  * Ability to think critically and arrive at elegant solutions to solve challenging problems.
  * Excellent communication skills and able to actively participate in team discussions, knowing when to contribute, when to listen, and when to ask questions.
  * Experience working with business teams to transform business requirements into functioning software.

Position is initially for 6 months, with a possible 6 month extension after
that. Supporting the Development lab in Vancouver, working on internal
projects – we need someone very experienced in Dev Ops functions. Hands on
coding exp. Automation coding. Ability to manage infrastructure. Able to
manage these two tools: Jenkins & Kubernetes/Kubernikus. Has experience in
cloud application deployment and monitoring and fine tuning it. Data flow from
one application to another - both are applying Kubernetes/Kubernikus. There is
an overall CCI Cloud compliance initiative coming up – this project is coming
up under that umbrella and we are focusing the development. Team set up – for
this position, they are working with the Vancouver team. We do have
development happening in Vancouver. The team is across two sites – one in
Shanghai and one in Vancouver. Regular office hours apply – there are time
that there may need to be a late night call with Shanghai, they will work
within the 40 hours.

**_Why Housecall Pro?_**

  * Housecall Pro is a mission-driven company - we champion the Service Pro to success.
  * We are tackling a large market ($700b+) generally underserved by technology and unencumbered by a dominant competitor.
  * Competitive compensation and benefits (medical, dental, vision, life, disability, employee assistance program, 401K) that start on day 1.
  * Our passionate employees bring their authentic selves to work. Housecall Pro employees are encouraged to create employee resource groups to make the world better (think volunteering and philanthropy).
  * Equity in a growth stage startup backed by top-tier VCs.
  * Paid holidays and self-managed take-it-as-you-need-it paid time off.
  * Opportunity to come onboard with a team and company that is rapidly growing and create your own career path

As a DevOps Engineer, you'll be part of a technical team that architects,
builds, maintains, scales, monitors, and secures the Housecall Pro cloud
infrastructure. This team promotes flexibility and autonomy and will empower
you with creative freedom and ownership in your work.

You will work as part of the larger Housecall Pro engineering team,
collaborating to identify and implement the tooling they need to iterate the
product lines rapidly and safely. Your ultimate goal is to enable engineering
to help good Pros become great Pros, and you will do that by creating a solid,
flexible, stable foundation that enables us to ship quickly and safely in the
face of massive growth.

This position requires enthusiasm for the details of code and systems running
"in the wild." You will face challenges with systems running real users and
data that require imagination, tenacity, and attention to detail. Curiosity
and the ability to learn on your feet will serve you well in this role.

Our Engineering team is extraordinary. We're a hardworking and focused team
driven to deliver industry-leading apps to our customers. Our success is their
success. Our team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused team
members are the "engine room" of Housecall Pro, helping our customers operate
and grow their businesses.

**Qualifications**

  * You enjoy a mixture of software engineering, site reliability engineering, automation, performance optimization, security, and operations work
  * High-level languages such as Ruby, Python, or JavaScript are in your suite of tools and they power automation tasks, and drive integrations with 3rd party APIs. Testing in one of these languages excites you. Accordingly, reading and reasoning about code you are not familiar with is a breeze
  * Linux has been part of your life for years at this point and other open-source tools are very familiar to you. Bash scripting accelerates your work. You know which tools to use to debug or optimise a misbehaving instance or container.
  * You have built infrastructure in a public cloud using Infrastructure as Code. You may have used tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, Pulumi, or CDK, or written directly against a cloud provider's API.
  * A strong familiarity with containerization tools like Docker is a must and running containers in production is second nature. You have used tools like AWS ECS, Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, or Mesos + Marathon.
  * You are familiar with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery/Deployment. You have automated deployment processes and created deployment pipelines. You have used tools like GitLabCI, Travis, CircleCI, etc.
  * You are comfortable with relational databases like MySQL or Postgres. You can optimize queries. You know when to add indexes. You understand how to run these with High Availability, and you know their limitations from experience.
  * You've worked in an Agile environment. You thrive on iteration. You make opportunities to bring value sooner rather than later.
  * You value data-driven decisions. You are always looking for opportunities to quickly produce the right data to make decisions quickly.
  * Communicating your plans and actions across the engineering team is your superpower. You can explain complex topics in simple ways. You know when to listen and when to push back. You keep cool under pressure.
  * You have experience with and embrace the challenge of building scalable infrastructure under constant change.
  * 2-8 years experience required; 4 years preferred

**As an exceptional candidate, some or all of the following may apply to
you:**

  * Canary Deploys, Blue/Green deploys, automated production testing, or other tools that enable Continuous Deployment.
  * You know the difference between a relational database and a NoSQL database, and when to use each.
  * You have worked with distributed systems. You understand the tradeoffs between Consistency, Availability, and Partition Tolerance that you must design around in a distributed world.

**Summary:**

Penguin Computing Managed Services provides dedicated, remote, Linux systems
administration for complex, integrated environments involving high-performance
computing, cloud, and enterprise systems. This position requires the ability
to understand, document, modify, configure, administer, troubleshoot, and
resolve issues regarding Penguin’s current configuration management code.
Successful candidates must have excellent communication skills, a friendly
demeanor, the ability to work with others, and to remain calm, focused, and
organized.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

  * Support, improve, document and write unit tests for all Ansible configuration management code for a Linux-based, high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI) environment.
  * Understand, monitor and measure customer requirements and project KPIs
  * Encourage and build automated processes.
  * Implement automation and testing tools to transform IT infrastructure
  * Provide technical review, verification, and validation of the software code developed in the project.
  * Provide general Linux system administration.
  * Plan the team’s activities and involvement in project management activities.
  * Manage stakeholders and external interfaces
  * Define development, test, release, update, and support processes for DevOps operation
  * Troubleshoot and remediate tool issues
  * Support and improve AWS s3 automation workflow
  * Identify and deploy cybersecurity measures by continuously performing vulnerability assessment and risk management
  * Incidence management and root cause analysis
  * Coordination and communication within the team and with customers
  * Strive for continuous improvement and build continuous integration, continuous development, and constant deployment pipeline (CI/CD Pipeline)
  * Provide periodic reports on progress to management and the customer.

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

  * Red Hat Certified Systems Administrator (RHCSA) or better.
  * Experience with bare metal provisioning (PXE and kickstart).
  * Experience with KVM virtualization.
  * Experience with use and configuration of Nagios and Prometheus.
  * AWS Datasync or other s3 tools.
  * Some knowledge of C as relates to Linux kernel/driver development.

 **Experience/Education:**

  * Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
  * 5 years working on Linux-based infrastructure.
  * Excellent understanding of (Ansible, Chef, or Puppet), Python, Perl, and Bash scripting
  * Proven professional experience with source control management.
  * Working knowledge of various tools, open-source technologies, and cloud services
  * Configuration and managing databases such as MySQL, Mongo
  * Proven professional experience with CI/CD pipelines (GitLab-CI, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, etc.)
  * Knowledge of Nvidia GPU architecture, drivers and monitoring APIs.
  * Practical knowledge of implementation and administration of High-Performance Computing (HPC) technologies, including cluster resource management, job scheduling, etc.
  * Configuration and managing databases such as MySQL, Mongo
  * Understanding of network technologies, architectures, and protocols.
  * Awareness of critical concepts in DevOps and Agile principles
  * Ability to communicate clearly and effectively

Up to 30%

 **There will be an Online Codility Test before the Interview**

 **Position: DevOps Platform Engineer**

 **Client: NIH (National Institutes of Health)**

 **Annual Salary: $140K/Yr, Only on W2**  
 **Location: Bethesda, MARYLAND (Remote until Covid restrictions lifted, then
it will be Onsite)**  
 **Duration: Full time/Permanent**

 **Job Description:** The Client is looking for DevOps Platform Engineer to
join our DevOps team.

 **Our DevOps team:**

  * Streamlines multi-language software development by providing tools and templates to solve common challenges of Continuous Integration

  * We support C++, Python and Scala, and also work with Go and Rust

  * Develops a modern continuous deployment platform with cutting-edge technologies (containers, cluster schedulers, service mesh, dynamic secrets provisioning)

  * Minimizes toil by automating configuration via codification (Terraform is one of our main instruments)

  * Works with product development teams to help them adopt the platform and best practices (we maintain some of the "core libraries" product teams rely on)

  * Performs research and evaluates new technologies to meet the most advanced demands of our product teams (e.g., delivering large, versioned data sets to applications running on Kubernetes)

  * Maintains a high level of education for ourselves and our customers (training courses on-site and off-site, conference attendance and tuition reimbursement)

  * Practices Agile development (Scrum) and continuous improvement

 **At its foundation, our deployment platform stands on:**

  * TeamCity for Continuous Integration (while also considering Jenkins and GitLab)

  * Artifactory for storing libraries developed internally, as well as container images (ECR and GCR experiments in cloud environments are planned)

  * Nomad and Kubernetes to schedule and run our deployments (currently transitioning from Nomad to Kubernetes)

  * Telegraf, InfluxDB, Kapacitor and Grafana along with OpsGenie for monitoring and alerting (recently set up Influx Enterprise cluster)

  * Consul and Linkerd for service discovery (we heavily contributed to Consul support in Linkerd in its early days)

  * Vault for secrets management (looking to scale it massively)

  * Puppet and Terraform for configuration management (we develop custom Terraform plugins for our specific needs)

  * AWS, GCP and on-premises datacenters (we strive to provide a seamless application deployment experience between data centers and clouds)

 **Duties & Responsibilities**

  * Analyze requirements presented by Product Owner and design sustainable solutions to advance deployment of platform functionality

  * Manage cloud infrastructure as code

  * Develop software to facilitate Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment

  * Troubleshoot performance and scalability issues in products and infrastructure

  * Mentor junior team members (or be a mentee)

 **Required Qualifications:**

  * B.S. in a STEM field (Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics)

  * Alternatively, equivalent industry experience in Software Development

  * Strong knowledge of at least one of the following programming languages: Python, Go, Java, Scala, Rust, C++; and desire to learn new languages

  * One plus years' of experience

  * Hands-on Linux experience. System programming expertise or understanding of how container runtimes work is a big plus

  * Experience with AWS, GCP, Azure, or other cloud service providers

  * Experience using cluster scheduler technologies (Kubernetes, Nomad, Mesos), or solid understanding of the concepts they operate upon

  * Understanding of distributed systems design principles (we will ask you about consensus, and we don't mean blockchain)

  * Customer-focused, team-oriented disposition

  * Interpersonal communications skills, to interface with customers, peers and management

  * Integrity and responsibility

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

  * Strong presentation skills

  * Experience mentoring other developers

  * Experience working with HashiCorp products

  * Experience setting up or using monitoring systems (Grafana, TICK Stack, Prometheus)

  * Experience managing stateful datasets in cloud environments

  * Any other DevOps technologies, any prior DevOps experience

Overview:

**DevOps Engineer (AWS)**

 **Full Time Remote, USA**

 **Contract to Possible Hire (W2)**

 **$115-130+/hr DOE**

 **  
**

**About the Position**

Amazon Interactive Video Service (IVS) is an AWS service that allows
developers to easily leverage the low-latency highly-distributed live video
platform that powers Twitch in their own applications. The Video Clients team
is looking for DevOps engineers to work on our CI/CD pipelines to support Web,
iOS, and Android clients. Our tooling pipelines will need to be stable and
reliable when building, testing, and deploying releases of our IVS SDKs.

  
You’ll make an impact on the largest live video entertainment platform in the
world with over 1 trillion minutes of content watched in 2020, and on a
rapidly growing and evolving AWS service.

  
If you are passionate about video, streaming, or entertainment, and obsessed
with building CI/CD pipelines and automation tools, then this is the position
for you.

 **  
Y** **ou Will**

  * Collaborate with engineers to understand their build pipelines and tooling needs.
  * Setup new operational systems and infrastructure.
  * Setup and maintain new build and Continuous Integration/Continuous Deploy systems.
  * Develop and maintain automated release systems.
  * Setup and integrate new monitoring and alerting systems.
  * Develop and maintain new services relevant to client operations.
  * Research new technologies and tooling.
  * Write automation scripts and tools in Python

 **  
Y** **ou Have**

  * 5+ years of experience in related DevOps roles
  * Experience configuring & managing build pipelines.
  * Experience with maintaining systems designed around Infrastructure as code (IaC).
  * Experience designing and maintaining scalable cloud infrastructure using AWS EC2, S3, and/or equivalent technologies.
  * Experience building CI/CD pipeline for Web, iOS, and/or Android apps and SDKs.
  * Experience with building CI/CD solutions using tools like TeamCity, Jenkins, Gitlab, and Artifactory, AWS CodePipeline and AWS CodeBuild.
  * Experience writing automation scripts in Python, Ruby, bash, or similar languages.

**Bonus Points**

  * Experience with cloud tools such as: Terraform, Docker, Cloud Development Kit (CDK), and CloudFormation.
  * Familiar with AWS Device Farms for Web and Mobile testing.Exposure to modern C++ 11 and higher, Emscripten, and WebAssembly.Understanding of video technologies.
  * Experience with platform pipelines, development, and languages related to Web, iOS, and/or Android.

  
Please submit your resume for consideration. Thank you!

Job Description:
Senior Linux Engineer QA DevOps REMOTE

We're a mid-sized security company (~100 people) with recent funding on a
mission to ensure the security of many global organizations. Our solution
software is configurable for both local and multinational organizations and
has evolved into the lightest, most scalable endpoint solution in the world.  
  
Our HQ is based on San Jose, CA and we do have offices in the UK, Netherlands
and Australia.  
  
This will be a full time role offering a base salary + bonus + equity/stock +
full benefits + REMOTE (work from home)!

####  **What You Will Be Doing**

_We are a venture-backed organization currently in hyper-growth mode. While
we're headquartered in New York City, all of our US based positions are
located 100% remote. The firm was founded by innovative practitioners to solve
the massive-scale cybersecurity challenges they saw daily while working for
leading global banks and technology organizations._

 _We are disrupting the cybersecurity operations market with innovation that
gives the firm claim to being the far-and-away ONLY company capable of
delivering technology to build cyber fusion centers for customers in large
enterprises and the mid-market._

Built on innovation designed by SecOps practitioners and cybersecurity
leaders, we offer multiple technologies within its next-generation platform,
including advanced threat intelligence solutions (TIP) for large and small
security teams, vendor-agnostic security automation (SOAR), and security case
management. As a result, organizations are able to increase speed and accuracy
while reducing costs and analyst burnout. Our cyber solutions make secure
collaboration, information sharing, and enhanced threat visibility a reality
for enterprises, sharing communities (ISAC/ISAO), MSSPs, and government
agencies of all sizes and needs.

  * You can lead on strategic and tactical initiatives

 **Why We're Hiring**  
The ideal candidate is motivated designing for scale, adoption of best
practices around security, continuous integration, configuration management,
infrastructure as code and has a strong interest in cloud engineering and
DevOps solutions. Working closely with the rest of the engineering team, you
will help ensure we are building high quality systems with monitoring best
practices, build and enhance automated solutions, accelerate customer value
delivery, and minimize human interactions with systems. We are seeking highly
collaborative, creative and intellectually curious DevOps Engineers who are
passionate about forming and implementing cutting-edge cloud computing
capabilities.

 **What You'll Do**

  * Work closely with development teams to integrate their projects into the production AWS environment and ensure their ongoing support once there.
  * Gain a deep application-level knowledge of the systems as well as contributing to their overall design.
  * Be a DevOps champion - work closely with other internal teams to build security, reliability, and scalability into the development lifecycle.
  * Dive deep into the software stack to troubleshoot as needed.
  * Build engineering automation and productivity tools to streamline and scale applications in the production environment.
  * Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to application development, deployment and operations.
  * Build from the ground up reliable infrastructure services in AWS to deliver highly scalable services.
  * Work with a team of peers who are smart, professional, pull their own weight, and share a passion for what they are creating.

 **Who You Are**

  * US Citizenship is a requirement of this position in accordance with 8 U.S.C 1324b(a)(2)(C)
  * 5+ years of experience as a DevOps Engineer in the software industry.
  * Hands on experience on cloud services like AWS, Google cloud, azure, etc.
  * Experience with tools like chef, puppet, ansible, etc.
  * Experience with infrastructure as code tools terraform or cloud formation.
  * Experience with different queuing systems like rabbitmq, kafka, sqs, etc.
  * Ability to create infra services for both cloud as well as on premise deployment.
  * Basic knowledge of networking concepts like subnets, etc.
  * Experience with containers and orchestration tools like kubernetes.
  * Experience working in a startup.
  * Exposure to Linux, EC2 Security, EC2 Balances, Automation Tools, AWS CLI,S3, Cloud Watch & Cloud Trail, SSH, Docker, Git, MLAB, Jenkins, Circle CI, Nagios, Jmeter & Blazemeter are must.
  * Knowledge on MongoDB, Python/Django, data structure and algorithms would be added advantage.
  * Experience with Rundeck is a plus

 **You'll love working here because:**

  * We value balance. We are committed to providing an environment in which you can balance great work with a great life. You'll have a generous PTO structure and holidays covered.
  * We're not just employees. We're people. We offer 401(k) match, insurance coverage (health, vision, and dental), and reimbursements for your home office.
  * We'll invest in your career. Our company's growing quickly, and we'll give you the opportunity to do the same. You'll have access to a number of professional development opportunities so that you can keep up with the company's evolving needs.
  * We offer competitive compensation packages. We deeply value the talent our team brings to the table and believe that fair and equitable total compensation packages are part of our commitment to everyone who works here.
  * And so much more…

**_**We are currently considering candidates outside of San Diego and
Denver**_**

**_Why Housecall Pro?_**

  * Housecall Pro is a mission-driven company - we champion the Service Pro to success.
  * We are tackling a large market ($700b+) generally underserved by technology and unencumbered by a dominant competitor.
  * Competitive compensation and benefits (medical, dental, vision, life, disability, employee assistance program, 401K) that start on day 1.
  * Our passionate employees bring their authentic selves to work. Housecall Pro employees are encouraged to create employee resource groups to make the world better (think volunteering and philanthropy).
  * Equity in a growth stage startup backed by top-tier VCs.
  * Paid holidays and self-managed take-it-as-you-need-it paid time off.
  * Opportunity to come onboard with a team and company that is rapidly growing and create your own career path

As a DevOps Engineer, you'll be part of a technical team that architects,
builds, maintains, scales, monitors, and secures the Housecall Pro cloud
infrastructure. This team promotes flexibility and autonomy and will empower
you with creative freedom and ownership in your work.

You will work as part of the larger Housecall Pro engineering team,
collaborating to identify and implement the tooling they need to iterate the
product lines rapidly and safely. Your ultimate goal is to enable engineering
to help good Pros become great Pros, and you will do that by creating a solid,
flexible, stable foundation that enables us to ship quickly and safely in the
face of massive growth.

This position requires enthusiasm for the details of code and systems running
"in the wild." You will face challenges with systems running real users and
data that require imagination, tenacity, and attention to detail. Curiosity
and the ability to learn on your feet will serve you well in this role.

Our Engineering team is extraordinary. We're a hardworking and focused team
driven to deliver industry-leading apps to our customers. Our success is their
success. Our team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused team
members are the "engine room" of Housecall Pro, helping our customers operate
and grow their businesses.

**Qualifications**

  * You enjoy a mixture of software engineering, site reliability engineering, automation, performance optimization, security, and operations work
  * High-level languages such as Ruby, Python, or JavaScript are in your suite of tools and they power automation tasks, and drive integrations with 3rd party APIs. Testing in one of these languages excites you. Accordingly, reading and reasoning about code you are not familiar with is a breeze
  * Linux has been part of your life for years at this point and other open-source tools are very familiar to you. Bash scripting accelerates your work. You know which tools to use to debug or optimise a misbehaving instance or container.
  * You have built infrastructure in a public cloud using Infrastructure as Code. You may have used tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, Pulumi, or CDK, or written directly against a cloud provider's API.
  * A strong familiarity with containerization tools like Docker is a must and running containers in production is second nature. You have used tools like AWS ECS, Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, or Mesos + Marathon.
  * You are familiar with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery/Deployment. You have automated deployment processes and created deployment pipelines. You have used tools like GitLabCI, Travis, CircleCI, etc.
  * You are comfortable with relational databases like MySQL or Postgres. You can optimize queries. You know when to add indexes. You understand how to run these with High Availability, and you know their limitations from experience.
  * You've worked in an Agile environment. You thrive on iteration. You make opportunities to bring value sooner rather than later.
  * You value data-driven decisions. You are always looking for opportunities to quickly produce the right data to make decisions quickly.
  * Communicating your plans and actions across the engineering team is your superpower. You can explain complex topics in simple ways. You know when to listen and when to push back. You keep cool under pressure.
  * You have experience with and embrace the challenge of building scalable infrastructure under constant change.
  * 2-8 years experience required; 4 years preferred

**As an exceptional candidate, some or all of the following may apply to
you:**

  * Canary Deploys, Blue/Green deploys, automated production testing, or other tools that enable Continuous Deployment.
  * You know the difference between a relational database and a NoSQL database, and when to use each.
  * You have worked with distributed systems. You understand the tradeoffs between Consistency, Availability, and Partition Tolerance that you must design around in a distributed world.

Compensation: $110 – 160k DOE

Founded in 2013, Housecall Pro has become the leader in the field service
management software space. We are committed to improving home service
professionals' business by providing solutions that support their success by
delivering software that includes scheduling, dispatching, job management,
invoicing, payment processing, and marketing. With over 200 employees in the
US and over $50M raised in venture capital, we are growing our organization

**About us**

SimuLogix LLC is an Aerospace/Defense Systems Engineering Service Provider
with 25+ years of Launch Vehicle and Spacecraft experience (including ground
systems). We are a small business focusing on Guidance, Navigation & Controls
Systems; System Engineering; Software Engineering; Electrical Engineering
(e.g. digital design/avionics, high-power electronics, RF/Communications,
EMI/EMC, EO/IR, etc…) and Mechanical Engineering (e.g. structural analysts,
solid modelers, thermal engineers, etc…). Our company headquarters are located
in California, but our engineers located throughout the country. SimuLogix
holds a TS Facility clearance. Several of our engineers have TS/SCI
clearances. We have years of experience working with spacecraft & launch
systems integrators including Aerojet-Rocketdyne, Lockheed-Martin, Raytheon,
Northrop-Grumman, General Dynamics, Boeing, Orbital-ATK (NGC IS), APL, SNC, as
well as their suppliers, e.g. Moog, Honeywell, Draper Labs,…. Additionally we
have been working with companies focused on some of the newer commercial
and/or crossover technologies including UAVs, cube satellites (e.g. Planet
Labs) and 3D metal printers. As all of us across the industry have realized we
must deal with Cyber Security and hence we are starting up a Cyber Security
division having recently hired a new manager to lead that. We now have both
hardware and software Cyber Security engineers onboard.

The successful candidate for this position will design, implement and
administer DevSecOps software factories. Support the design, procurement and
instantiation of a Software Factory to operate across a multi-site network.
Monitor and maintain the operation of the software factory to support high
reliability program execution and manage user accounts. The candidate will
develop and maintain automation pipelines. The candidate will also be expected
to interact with the other divisions within the company, partner organizations
as well as the end customer.

 **Essential Functions:**

· Maintains smooth operation of multi-user computer systems, including
coordination with network administrators.

· Purchases hardware and software, coordinates installation and provides
backup recovery.

· Develops and monitors policies and standards for allocation related to the
use of computing resources.

· Ancillary duties may include setting up administrator and service accounts,
maintaining system documentation, tuning system performance, installing system
wide software and allocating mass storage space.

The selected candidate should thrive in a fast-paced work environment with
high expectations, significantly diverse assignments, and collaborative/team
settings across all levels.

 **Level 3 Requirements:** Bachelor's degree with 5 years of experience;
Master's with 3 years of experience.

 **Level 4 Requirements:** Bachelor's degree with 9 years of experience;
Master's with 7 years of experience; PhD with 4 years of experience.

 **Basic Qualifications:**

· The ideal candidate shall possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or
Computer Engineering or other technical degree.

· A security clearance or the ability to obtain a security clearance is
required. Candidates should have experience with large software systems and
the full software development lifecycle

· Experience with software development (Java/Javascript, C++, C# or any modern
object-oriented language) and its life cycle

· Experience with build tools (i.e., Maven, Ant, GNU make) and/or continuous
integration environments (i.e., Jenkins, GitLab, Bamboo) and/or repositories
(i.e. Nexus, JFROG)

· Experience with Windows and Linux/Unix administration

· Prior experience with DevOps and/or Software Factory implementation

· Familiarity with scripting languages (i.e. PERL, Python, Bash, YAML)

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

· Proficiency with Linux and Linux based software development tools

· Experience with Client/Server application software development

· Experience with automation/configuration management using either Ansible,
Chef or equivalent

· Experience with CMM/SEI or equivalent software development process

· Integrate complex systems that facilitate continuous build, continuous
integration, continuous test, continuous deployment

· Direct Experience with build tools (i.e., Make, Gradle) and continuous
integration environments (i.e., Jenkins, GitLab, Bamboo)

· Strong direct experience background in Agile methodology

· Experience with source code configuration management tools (i.e git)

· Ability to automate software builds and releases

· Experience with spacecraft or launch systems software development is highly
desired.

· Experience using Amazon Web Services, Azure, including using AWS native
services (Cloud Formation, S3, etc.) is a plus

· Experience with concepts such as micro services (including scalability best
practices), containers, and container orchestration using Docker or Kubernetes

· Excellent communication, interpersonal skills, and the ability to interface
with all levels of employees and management

· CompTIA Security+ certification or equivalent
